runs.comm: flighted offbreak, neatly punched to long-on for one
drills the first ball he faces down the ground. There is a long-on in place, though

beaten in the flight, and we have timbahhhhh. Hafeez has seen Charles advancing, I think, and he shortens his length. Charles still appears in charge, but he plays the defensive shot for the offbreak. The ball doesn't turn, and hits the off stump
full and flat, defended to cover
pushed wide of mid-off for a single
on a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot
Samuels stays back to a length ball, drives it to cover
short, wide, pretty easy, and cut away to the right of backward point
short of a length, on the stumps, Samuels still manages to open the face and guide it to third man
goes full and fast but also goes too straight, and Gayle nudges it down to fine leg
short of a length, rising towards the chest, defended in front of the chest
full, on off, defended from the crease
full, offbreak, played back to him
short of a length, flicked to short midwicket where Afridi's footwork keeps them pinned at their ends
topspinner, around off, defended back
slower, offbreak, seems to have beaten the inside edge and gone for a leg-bye to short fine

Gayle won't be hitting into the sea tonight. Hafeez has got him. Hafeez stays full and around middle and off, Gayle plays a defensive, but the bat is either hidden behind or is playing for an offbreak. This one goes with the angle, and Gayle seems pretty plumb despite that big stride of his
flighted outside off, defended off the front foot
short, not too wide, beats his cut with a little extra bounce
nice shot. This time Samuels makes a slight forward movement, but stands tall as Irfan pitches short and cuts this through point
Doesn't matter the number of fielders. Samuels has split those three fielders in the point region. Backs away a little to create his own room and cut this from the line of off
Irfan might have gone round the stumps but he is still pitching short, and has been cut away again. This time, though, Shehzad does the fielding at backward point
spongy bounce this time on the shortish ball. Might have been the slower ball too. Beats his push
this time Samuels says you can stack that point region all you want, because I can go over them too. Rises with the bounce, takes this from chest-high, and upper-cuts it over point
goes wide of the crease, angles one in, beats the inside edge, hits the pad, but is headed down leg
not a warm welcome to Babar. He goes wide of the crease again, doesn't try to turn the ball much, and Simmons plays the pick-up shot to send this length ball over wide long-on
angling in, defended again

now that one has turned. And the top of off has been hit. Extra revs on this. Babar might have dragged this a little short, but the ball rips away after pitching middle and off, squares Simmons up, and bowls him. Beats him by a long distance too. Bear in mind he is bowling from wide of the crease
fires into the pads from his wide angle, at 86ks, nicely deflected away fine of short fine leg
flighted, but this doesn't turn and hits the inside half of the defensive bat
shortish offbreak, defended in front of off
flighted, another offbreak, but this one doesn't turn as much as he expects, and is beaten on the outside edge
stays back to a length-ball offbreak, and nearly chops on
one-handed cover-drive against the turn. This time Samuels finally presses forward, and as he drives this offbreak, the top hand comes off the handle, but he has found the timing and the placement
flatter, on off, defended back to him
tossed up outside off, pushed to cover. Wants one but realises he has hit straight to the fielder
Bravo plays for the turn, the ball doesn't, hits the inside half of the bat for a single

huge wicket on debut. Samuels has been hitting every bowler around. And he has been caught-and-bowled. What a debut for Babar. Samuels, like he did with Afridi during the ODIs, charges down, takes this on a half-volley and drills one down the ground. This time, though, he has hit it straight back at Babar, who is alert and quick to take it with both hands. Comes at a comfortable height but an uncomfortable pace. He has hurt his left hand while taking the catch
Pollard hits back first ball. Length ball, flat, middle and leg, and Pollard drives this between the bowler and mid-on

and had mid-on not been moved back, this would have been an easy catch for him. Pollard drives again, powerfully so, but he can't keep it down. Bounces short of long-on. They take only one despite a diving save at the boundary
sharp turn now. Only the second one he has turned today, but that's all you need in T20 if you are accurate. Beaten
more dozey running. Hit wide of deep cover, but they take just the one
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
appeal for pad first as this has been fired in at 102ks. Would have been plumb had Pollard not got an inside edge
flighted into the pads, worked away to deep midwicket
tossed up, middle and leg, holds its line, hits the pad

more unsure running between the Trini boys. This legbreak hits the inside half of the bat, doesn't go too far off the wicket, but Pollard makes a late decision to call him through. Umar Akmal can't hit the stumps at the non-striker's end otherwise we would have had a close appeal
Pollard is not looking comfortable against Afridi. With cement feet he defends a legbreak to cover
pushed wide of point for one
length ball, on off, defended to cover

Pollard nearly gets himself out. He is not backing himself to play solid cricket. Throws his arms at a length ball, in front of his body, and skies it towards cover. It falls short of the fielder, though
this one turns, and past the edge it goes
arm ball, Pollard plays a late dab, gets a single to short third. Finally, some smooth running
flighted outside off, holds its line, bounces too, ad beats the outside edge
cement feet again. Pollard just throws his bat at another, and gets an inside edge to short fine leg
flighted, on middle and leg, this time he bunts it to leg for one
quick legbreak, but a little short. Punched to long-off for one
driven to deep cover for one
he has nudged this to leg, from middle and off. That excites the fielders a bit
finally an overpitched delivery, and that is in Pollard's zone. He has smoked it clean back over Afridi's head.
sharp offbreak, cramps him up. Defended
Jamshed misfields at the boundary. Punched to the right of deep point, Jamshed gets there, but is slow in getting down
another offbreak that doesn't turn as much as expected, and beats the outside edge
fuller, flatter, hits the pad, deflects to the keeper
defended back to him
flat offbreak, played back to him
quick legbreak, Pollard is a little surprised. Goes off the outside half of the bat for one
another quick legbreak, wide outside off, beats his drive, but goes for two byes off Akmal's glove
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep point
short of a length, turns from outside leg to outside off, punched into the deep

flighted on middle and leg, bunted into the leg side, towards deep midwicket, they come back for two. Afridi is not happy with the fielders. "Tum toh jawan ladke ho yaar," Afridi tells them all. [You are young boys. Should do better.]
chipped over cover for a single
flighted outside off, opens the face, gets a single to Irfan at short third man
Pollard fumbles in the dark. The ball doesn't turn, and angles past the defensive bat
flat offbreak, punched to midwicket for one
full, flat, outside off, defended to cover. Pollard, who is not looking, is hit on the shoulder. The throw is soft, though
short of a length, outside off, played with an open face for one
just a flick but this is a half-volley, and Pollard doesn't spare half-volleys. Drilled back over Ajmal's head
short of a length, outside off, just holds its line, beats his late-cut
flat, on off, worked to leg for one
quick, goes with the arm, punched to long-on for one
tossed up on middle and off, doesn't turn enough, hits the inside half of the bat for one
slower, but a little short, and has been punched away nicely, with the turn, and past point for two
tossed up wide, Pollard drives with no feet, and is beaten. Afridi's allotment is over. Run-a-ball and wicketless
short of a length, on off, defended

short-arm pull. Lovely flair-full shot, but Bravo has presumed this has gone for four. Amin surprises him with a dive at deep midwicket. And the Trini boys have just taken one presuming it has gone for four
full and on off, pushed back to him
full, angling into the pads, nicely wristed away through square leg for four. Pollard has punished everything that has been loose today
short of a length, stays low, beats his pull, draws an lbw appeal, but it is still bouncing over
dug in short again, Bravo is in the air trying to work this to leg. Is beaten, but takes the leg-bye
and he gets turn and bounce as he bowls slowly, and beats his outside edge
this one angles in, goes off the inside half of the bat
short of a length, turning away, punched down to long-off for one
short again, but this time he finds the straight extra cover

Bravo tries a really difficult shot. The back-foot drive over cover for six. If there is any man who hits it in today's cricket, it is Bravo. This time, though, he has taken on too much even though he has hit it with the wind. Ajmal moves to his right at deep cover to complete the catch. Taken over his shoulder with the wind taking the ball away
this one doesn't turn, angles in, beats the inside edge, hits his pad. Superb debut for Babar: 4-0-23-3
short of a length, just outside off, defended to cover
Sammy looks to pull, gets a bottom edge onto the hip
yorker. Accurate. Dug out. Perfect delivery
lucky runs. Pollard swings and swings hard, but all he manages is an inside edge that drags this from wide outside off to send it fine of short fine leg
short of a length, into the pads, tucked away for a single

swirling hit. That is some power. This is a half-volley. Sammy goes deep into the crease to bulldoze it back. Starts on the leg side of the stumps at the non-striker's end, but swerves so much with the force that it ends up at long-off
Pakistan don't want this. Offbreak that starts outside leg, and turns enough to beat Akmal to go for five wides
pushed wide of cover for one
flighted outside off, angles away to beat the outside edge
shortish, tucked away off the hip
stays back to a full offbreak. Gets a single into the midwicket region
doosra. Starts outside leg. Sammy picks it only off the pitch. Defends
short of a length, quick, angling away, beats Sammy's attempt at punching this into the off side
full, angling in, mowed to deep midwicket

Sammy has picked the slower ball early, sized it up, and smoked it out. He pushes the weight onto the back foot, gets under the length ball, and smashes this over wide long-on. Somebody return the ball please
wide full toss. This is clearly a wide, but Nero raises the batsmen's eyebrows by calling it very late
another full toss but this time it is closer to off, and does the job well: to stay away from Sammy, who is backing away
dropped by Amin. This is full, into the pads, and has been lofted towards the cow corner. Amin comes around from deep midwicket, the catch is high to his left, but he has parried it over the bar
Junaid looks to go full and wide as Sammy looks to back away, but the batsman does well to drill this wide of cover for four

slower ball, bunted into the leg side, straight to deep midwicket, but Sammy is one of the best with converting ones into twos. He puts his head down, and takes what seems a suicidal second. The throw is flat, full, stump high, and straight, but Sammy has beaten it
short of a length, Pollard seems to be expecting it, backs away and lofts it over wide long-on for six
full toss, into the pads, wide of long-on, and even though Sammy has dropped his bat a misfield allows them a second
finally a yorker. Dug out. Sammy is backing up a long way. He is halfway up the wicket when the ball touches bat. Easy single for him
yorker gone wrong. Knee-high full toss. There is no room, but somehow Sammy has lofted this clean over long-on for a six. He keeps pumping his fist after every such shot
this time he has gone into the wind. Irfan goes short, Sammy goes hard, and hooks with the front leg in the air. The wind holds it up, though, and he is taken at deep midwicket

poor from Narine. This is hit down the ground, to the left of long-on, and there is no way the non-striker shouldn't make it for the second. Sammy would have made this comfortably. Narine is run out by a mile. Had he been as intentful as Sammy, he might have got Pollard a deserved fifty
